info.title: Stedi Claims Manager
info.description:
The Stedi Claims Manager Service manages healthcare claims for providers and payers.
It tracks claim status, processes claim data, and supports CRUD operations
for managing 837 institutional, dental, and professional claims, as well as
claim acknowledgments from payers and clearinghouses.

get.description: Retrieves a list of claim acknowledgments with optional filtering and pagination.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of elements to return in a page. If not specified, the default is 100.

schema.description: The maximum number of elements to return in a page. If not specified, the default is 100.

ListAcknowledgments_example4.summary: Filter Acknowledgments by Patient Control Number

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: An opaque token returned by a previous call to this endpoint in the `nextPageToken` property. You can use it to request the next page of results. If not specified, Stedi returns the first page of results.

schema.description: An opaque token returned by a previous call to this endpoint in the `nextPageToken` property. You can use it to request the next page of results. If not specified, Stedi returns the first page of results.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments with properties matching a query string. You can provide all or part of a source name, claim ID, transaction control number, or patient control number. The search is case-insensitive and supports fuzzy matching.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments with properties matching a query string. You can provide all or part of a source name, claim ID, transaction control number, or patient control number. The search is case-insensitive and supports fuzzy matching.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments with specific statuses. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple statuses.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments with specific statuses. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple statuses.

parameters.name: claimId
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments for a specific claim ID.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments for a specific claim ID.

parameters.name: receivedFrom
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments received from a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments received from a specific date.

parameters.name: receivedTo
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments received before a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments received before a specific date.

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments created from a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments created from a specific date.

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments created before a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments created before a specific date.

parameters.name: patientControlNumber
parameters.description: Filter for acknowledgments with a specific patient control number.

schema.description: Filter for acknowledgments with a specific patient control number.

ListAcknowledgments_example4.summary: Filter Acknowledgments by Patient Control Number
Filter Acknowledgments by Patient Control Number

post.description: Creates a new claim acknowledgment. Acknowledgments represent responses from payers or clearinghouses regarding the processing status of submitted claims.

delete.description: Deletes a specific claim acknowledgment by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: acknowledgmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to delete.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to delete.

get.description: Retrieves a specific claim acknowledgment by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: acknowledgmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to retrieve.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to retrieve.

put.description: Updates an existing claim acknowledgment with new information.

parameters.name: acknowledgmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to update.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the acknowledgment to update.

get.description: Lists healthcare claims with optional filtering and pagination. Returns a summary of each claim.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of elements to return in a page. If not specified, the default is 100.

schema.description: The maximum number of elements to return in a page. If not specified, the default is 100.

ListClaims_example3.summary: Filter by Status and Date Range

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: An opaque token returned by a previous call to this endpoint in the `nextPageToken` property. You can use it to request the next page of results. If not specified, Stedi returns the first page of results.

schema.description: An opaque token returned by a previous call to this endpoint in the `nextPageToken` property. You can use it to request the next page of results. If not specified, Stedi returns the first page of results.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter for claims with properties matching a query string. You can provide all or part of a provider name, provider ID, patient name, patient control number, or payer ID. The search is case-insensitive and supports fuzzy matching.

schema.description: Filter for claims with properties matching a query string. You can provide all or part of a provider name, provider ID, patient name, patient control number, or payer ID. The search is case-insensitive and supports fuzzy matching.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for claims with specific statuses. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple statuses.

schema.description: Filter for claims with specific statuses. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple statuses.

ListClaims_example3.summary: Filter by Status and Date Range

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter for claims of specific types. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple types.

schema.description: Filter for claims of specific types. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple types.

parameters.description: Filter for claims associated with specific provider IDs. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple provider IDs.

schema.description: Filter for claims associated with specific provider IDs. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple provider IDs.

parameters.name: payerIds
parameters.description: Filter for claims associated with specific payer IDs. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple payer IDs.

schema.description: Filter for claims associated with specific payer IDs. You can include this parameter multiple times to filter for multiple payer IDs.

parameters.name: createdTo
parameters.description: Filter for claims created before a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for claims created before a specific date.

parameters.name: serviceDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter for claims with service dates from a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for claims with service dates from a specific date.

parameters.name: serviceDateTo
parameters.description: Filter for claims with service dates before a specific date.

schema.description: Filter for claims with a specific patient control number.

ListClaims_example3.summary: Filter by Status and Date Range

post.description: Creates a new healthcare claim. Claims represent requests for payment from healthcare providers to payers for services rendered to patients. This operation also supports claim resubmission by providing the originalClaimId parameter to link the new claim as a resubmission of an existing claim.

value.resubmissionReason: Corrected claim amount from $250.00 to $275.00 due to additional services provided during the visit that were initially omitted.
Corrected claim amount from $250.00 to $275.00 due to additional services provided during the visit that were initially omitted.

delete.description: Deletes a healthcare claim. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the claim from the system.

parameters.name: claimId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the claim to delete.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the claim to delete.

value.message: Claim claim_98765 has been successfully deleted.

get.description: Retrieves a specific healthcare claim by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: claimId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the claim to retrieve.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the claim to retrieve.

put.description: Updates an existing healthcare claim with new information. Only mutable fields can be modified.

parameters.name: claimId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the claim to update.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the claim to update.

AccessDeniedExceptionResponseContent.description: The server response for authorization failure.

AcknowledgmentStatus.description: The processing status of the claim as reported in the acknowledgment.

AcknowledgmentSummary.description: Summary of an acknowledgment with essential fields for list operations.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned unique identifier for the acknowledgment.

claimId.description: The unique identifier of the claim this acknowledgment relates to.

status.description: The processing status of the claim as reported in the acknowledgment.

source.description: The entity that sent this acknowledgment.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the acknowledgment record was created in the system.

receivedAt.description: The date and time when the acknowledgment was received.

errorCount.description: The number of errors reported in this acknowledgment.

patientControlNumber.description: The patient control number from the original claim.

coreTransactionId.description: The core transaction identifier that links this acknowledgment to the underlying EDI transaction.

AcknowledmentError.description: An error reported in the claim acknowledgment.

severity.description: The severity level of this error.

fieldReference.description: Reference to the specific field or segment that caused the error.

ClaimConflictExceptionResponseContent.description: Thrown when a claim operation would create a conflict.

ClaimNotFoundExceptionResponseContent.description: Thrown when a claim cannot be found.

ClaimStatus.description: The status of the claim during processing.

ClaimSummary.description: Summary of a claim with essential fields for list operations.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned unique identifier for the claim.

stediPayerId.description: The unique Stedi assigned identifier for the payer processing this claim.

status.description: The current processing status of the claim.

providerId.description: The unique identifier for the healthcare provider submitting the claim.

providerName.description: The name of the healthcare provider submitting the claim.

amount.description: The total monetary amount being claimed for the services provided.

type.description: The type of claim based on the healthcare setting and provider type.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the claim record was created in the system.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the claim record was last updated.

submittedAt.description: The date and time when the claim was originally submitted to the payer.

patientName.description: The patient's name for whom the services were provided.

patientControlNumber.description: The patient control number assigned by the provider for tracking purposes.

coreTransactionId.description: The core transaction identifier that links this claim to the underlying EDI transaction.

ClaimType.description: The type of healthcare claim based on the care setting and provider type.

claimId.description: The unique identifier of the claim this acknowledgment relates to.

status.description: The processing status of the claim as reported in the acknowledgment.

source.description: The entity that sent this acknowledgment (payer name or clearinghouse).

transactionControlNumber.description: The X12 transaction control number from the acknowledgment.

errors.description: List of errors reported in the acknowledgment.

receivedAt.description: The date and time when the acknowledgment was received.

patientControlNumber.description: The patient control number from the original claim, used for tracking purposes.

coreTransactionId.description: The core transaction identifier that links this acknowledgment to the underlying EDI transaction.

stediPayerId.description: The unique Stedi assigned identifier for the payer processing this claim.

status.description: The current processing status of the claim.

providerId.description: The unique identifier for the healthcare provider submitting the claim.

providerName.description: The name of the healthcare provider submitting the claim.

amount.description: The total monetary amount being claimed for the services provided.

type.description: The type of claim based on the healthcare setting and provider type.

submittedAt.description: The date and time when the claim was originally submitted to the payer. This may differ from createdAt if the claim was imported from another system.

memberId.description: The subscriber's member ID or policy number with the payer.

groupNumber.description: The subscriber's group number for group insurance plans.

patientName.description: The patient's name for whom the services were provided.

serviceDate.description: The date of service when the healthcare services were provided.

diagnosisCode.description: The diagnosis code (ICD-10) for the patient's condition.

procedureCode.description: The procedure code (CPT/HCPCS) for the services performed.

placeOfService.description: The place of service where the healthcare services were provided.

patientControlNumber.description: The patient control number assigned by the provider for tracking purposes.

coreTransactionId.description: The core transaction identifier that links this claim to the underlying EDI transaction.

originalClaimId.description: The unique identifier of the original claim if this is a resubmission. When provided, this claim becomes a resubmission of the referenced original claim.

resubmissionReason.description: The reason for resubmitting this claim. Required when originalClaimId is provided.

CreateClaimResponseContent.description: Output containing the created claim details.

id.description: The Stedi-assigned unique identifier for the claim.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the claim record was created in the system.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the claim record was last updated.

isResubmission.description: Indicates whether this claim is a resubmission of another claim.

latestClaimId.description: The unique identifier of the latest claim in the resubmission chain. For original claims that have been resubmitted, this points to the most recent resubmission. For resubmitted claims, this is typically the claim's own ID unless it has been further resubmitted.

ValidationExceptionField.description: Describes one specific validation failure for an input member.

path.description: A JSONPointer expression to the structure member whose value failed to satisfy the modeled constraints.

message.description: A detailed description of the validation failure.

ValidationExceptionResponseContent.description:
A standard error for input validation failures.
This should be thrown by services when a member of the input structure
falls outside of the modeled or documented constraints.

message.description: A summary of the validation failure.

fieldList.description:
A list of specific failures encountered while validating the input.
A member can appear in this list more than once if it failed to satisfy multiple constraints.
